text: Red huckleberry (Vaccinium parvifolium) is a species of Vaccinium, a flowering plant. It grows in North America. There, it is often found in forests from southeastern Alaska and British Columbia, through western Washington and Oregon to central California. In the Oregon Coast Range, it is the most-seen Vaccinium. ==Growth== Red huckleberry is a shrub. It grows to tall. The fruit grown on the plant is a berry which can be eaten. It can be from to in diameter. ==Gallery== Image:Vaccinium parvifolium 04041.JPG|Newly opened leaves Image:Vaccinium_parvifolium_38913.JPG|Blossoms Image:RedHuckleberryBlossom.png|Blossoms File:Vaccinium_parvifolium_0325.JPG|Leaves and fruit ==References== ==Other websites== *Germplasm Resources Information Network: Vaccinium parvifolium *Jepson Flora Project: Vaccinium parvifolium *Native American Ethnobotany: Vaccinium parvifolium *Plants of British Columbia: Vaccinium parvifolium *USDA: Vaccinium parvifolium Category:Vaccinium Category:Berries
